item.title: Jessica Star add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Seldom, very seldom, does complete truth belong to any human disclosure; seldom can it happen that something is not a little disguised or a little mistaken." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jessica Star add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jessica Star add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Jessica Star add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica Star add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I had not intended to love him; the reader knows I had wrought hard to extirpate from my soul the germs of love there detected; and now, at the first renewed view of him, they spontaneously revived, great and strong! He made me love him without looking at me." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jessica Star add a quote by Jayne Anne Phillips
item.description: "The writer's first affinity is not to a loyalty, a tradition, a morality, a religion, but to life itself, and to its representation in language." -- Jayne Anne Phillips

item.title: Jessica Star add a quote by Sharon Olds
item.description: "I was a late bloomer. But anyone who blooms at all, ever, is very lucky. " -- Sharon Olds
